content.question: ​In the tidal area of a certain city, a sinusoidal function <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals a sin open parentheses b open parentheses x plus c close parentheses close parentheses plus d"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>b</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="a"><semantics><mi>a</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="b"><semantics><mi>b</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="c"><semantics><mi>c</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, and <math alttext="d"><semantics><mi>d</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> are constants, is used to model one cycle of high and low tides. The maximum value of the tide is <math alttext="8.88"><semantics><mn>8.88</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> feet, and the minimum value of the tide is <math alttext="0.54"><semantics><mn>0.54</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> feet in that cycle. If the values of  <math alttext="b"><semantics><mi>b</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="c"><semantics><mi>c</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, and <math alttext="d"><semantics><mi>d</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> have already been determined to fit the data, which of the following would best define <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="4.17 sin open parentheses b open parentheses x plus c close parentheses close parentheses plus d"><semantics><mrow><mn>4.17</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>b</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​​<math alttext="4.44 sin open parentheses b open parentheses x plus c close parentheses close parentheses plus d"><semantics><mrow><mn>4.44</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>b</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​​<math alttext="4.71 sin open parentheses b open parentheses x plus c close parentheses close parentheses plus d"><semantics><mrow><mn>4.71</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>b</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​​<math alttext="8.34 sin open parentheses b open parentheses x plus c close parentheses close parentheses plus d"><semantics><mrow><mn>8.34</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>b</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="4.17 sin open parentheses b open parentheses x plus c close parentheses close parentheses plus d"><semantics><mrow><mn>4.17</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>b</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
